fraser-etal-2022-moral.title: Does Moral Code have a Moral Code? Probing Delphi's Moral Philosophy
fraser-etal-2022-moral.author:
Fraser, Kathleen C.  and
Kiritchenko, Svetlana  and
Balkir, Esma
fraser-etal-2022-moral.paperMotivationText: The paper aims at answering the RQ: “Which types of ethical or moral principles do AI systems implicitly learn during training?”
fraser-etal-2022-moral.paperContributionText: Probing the Allen AI Delphi model with a set of standardized morality questionnaires,
fraser-etal-2022-moral.paperResultsText: The results showt that Delphi has learned a consistent ethical framework, primarily aligned with liberal Western views that elevate Autonomy over Community and Divinity, rank the individualizing foundations of Caring and Fairness above the binding foundations of Loyalty, Authority, and Purity, and support the utilitarian principle of Impartial Benefience but reject the principle of Instrumental Harm.
fraser-etal-2022-moral.dataOtherText: Questionnaires and short moral dilemma stories (for probing Delphi)
fraser-etal-2022-moral.resourcesOtherText: The Community, Autonomy, and Divinity Scale (CADS), Oxford Utilitarianism Scale (OUS)
